description: A sample contains information on the biosample that was sequenced or imaged. This includes donor, body part, and anything that comes between removing the sample from a donor and the assay.

^characteristics_.*$.description: Fields that begin with characteristics_ can contain any value, and the field name can be anything after the prefix.

sample_id.description: A local identifier for the sample. Should be unique in the context of the project.

name.description: A short, descriptive name for the sample that need not be unique.

description.description: A general description of the sample.

genus_species.description: Scientific binomial name of donor species. e.g. "homo sapiens". NCBI taxon in ontology field.

derived_from.description: If this sample is derived from another sample e.g. a tissue or donor, enter the sample_id for the sample this was derived from
derived_from.comment: This field is primarily required for spreadsheet based submissions

supplementary_files.description: A list of filenames of sample-level supplementary files.

sample_accessions.description: One or more accession numbers from a standard archive.

biosd_sample.description: A DDBJ, NCBI, or EBI BioSample ID. Accessions must start with SAMD, SAMN, or SAME.

insdc_sample.description: An INSDC (International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration) sample accession. Can be from the DDBJ, EMBL-EBI, or NCBI. Accession must start with DRS, ERS, or SRS.

title: sample
